item.title: Fallout Creator Talks About the Fate of the Talking Deathclaws
item.description:
Highlights

  • Fallout 2 designer John Deiley envisioned sapient deathclaws for Vault 13, but they were killed off before further development.
  • Fallout 2 stands out for its humor, with pop-culture references like Monty Python and The Terminator.
  • Despite radical lore concepts like talking plants and ghosts, the pacifist deathclaws of Vault 13 would have been an unique and subversive addition.

Fallout 2 designer John Deiley discussed his original idea for the intelligent deathclaws of Vault 13, and how they were unceremoniously killed off before they could be developed further as a concept. Even though the Fallout franchise has always been known for its special brand of humor contrasted against the bleakness of a post-apocalyptic wasteland, Fallout 2 is widely viewed as the entry where its humor is front and center. The wasteland is littered with pop-culture references, from Monty Python to The Terminator , and even the player protagonist being ironically referred to as The Chosen One exemplifies the overall direction that Fallout 2 decided to take.

While each corner of Fallout 2 toys with radical lore concepts, such as talking plants, ghosts, or radscorpions playing chess, it could be argued that the sapient deathclaws of Vault 13 take the cake. Deathclaws in Fallout are considered to be formidable, terrifying enemies, and taking down a deathclaw is often seen as a rite of passage for new fans of the franchise. However, Fallout 2 subverts this concept entirely by placing them in the role of pacifists who escaped from the Enclave and began a community of their own inside Vault 13.

5:56
Related
Every Fallout Game In Chronological Order

Every game was not released in the historical chronological order of the post-apocalyptic alternate timeline world of the Fallout series.

Fallout 2's Intelligent Deathclaws Originally Had a Bigger Role to Play

This idea came from the mind of John Deiley, who recently sat down with TheGamer for an interview about Fallout 2 's intelligent deathclaws and what it was like to work with Chris Avellone. He was asked by Fallout 2 director Feargus Urquhart to design something unique for Vault 13 , which eventually led to Deiley pitching the idea of sapient deathclaws that could talk. Urquhart was ecstatic about the concept and gave Deiley permission to go ahead with production.

Though Chris Avellone deemed it too silly for the setting, Deiley defended his idea. “I mean, you’ve got super mutants, you’ve got ghouls, why not have something that can stand up to the super mutants?” His long-term plan for the deathclaws was to have them emigrate from the vault in future Fallout games , and try to establish a civilization. “There was going to be an internal conflict with them, the devil within. They were planning, once they were more secure, on altering power armor to fit their physique. And then they were going to pay the Enclave a visit and get as many vials of the FEV virus as they could, kidnap a scientist or two, and make some improvements.”

“I mean, you’ve got super mutants, you’ve got ghouls, why not have something that can stand up to the super mutants?” - John Deiley

However, it was not to be. One day, as Deiley was walking down the hallway, he saw Feargus Urquhart in a programmer's office, working on Vault 13. They had decided to cut the location from the Fallout game, but instead of removing it entirely, the intelligent deathclaws in the final version of Fallout 2 are wiped out by the Enclave and Frank Horrigan, their super mutant Secret Service agent clad in power armor. While Fallout has a deathclaw companion in Goris, he and Xarn remain the only members of their kind after the events of Fallout 2 , making any future appearances unlikely.

item.title: DCEU Actor Stirs Nightwing Rumors in DCU with Social Media Post
item.description:
Highlights

  • Asher Angel teases potential involvement in upcoming DC Universe project through Nightwing-themed social media post, exciting fans.
  • Fans speculate that Angel, known for portraying Billy Batson in Shazam!, could take on the role of Grayson in the new Bat Family franchise.
  • Director James Gunn remains tight-lipped on the release date of The Brave and the Bold, leaving fans buzzing with anticipation.

A prominent DCEU actor drops hints about potential involvement in James Gunn's upcoming DC Universe project through a cryptic Nightwing-themed social media post.

Dick Grayson is one of the most beloved and popular characters in the world of DC Comics. However, the character hasn’t been yet fully explored in live-action titles, except for the Titans series. With the Bat Family set to appear in DCU ’s Batman reboot film, The Brave and the Bold, it’s like Grayson might turn out to be a key figure in the newly announced franchise. Although the casting hasn’t been finalized, it seems one of the actors from DCEU might be ready to don the iconic suit.

RELATED
Another Actor Gets The Batman Treatment In Impressive Fanart

Following his stint as a superhero, this MCU star is envisioned as one of the iconic DC characters in flawlessly rendered fanart.

On social media platform X , actor Asher Angel, who portrays Billy Batson in Shazam!, and its sequel, sparked speculation about joining the DC Universe with a suggestive Nightwing GIF. Although the actor didn’t write anything with the GIF, he certainly made fans excited about the character’s future in the upcoming franchise. Angel is one of the stars that fans have been rallying behind since it was announced that the entire Bat Family was going to be introduced in Gunn’s DCU. He is one of the most popular fancasts to portray Grayson in the upcoming film.

Angel was one of the most distinguished members of the DCEU and played the young Billy Batson in both Shazam! films. The first film in the franchise turned out to be a gigantic hit and garnered universal acclaim. However, the second movie performed poorly at the box office and didn’t get much love from the audiences as well. Nevertheless, fans loved Angel’s impeccable acting skills in both titles. Some even noted that his portrayal of the aforementioned character in the second film, Shazam! Fury of the Gods was better than Zachary Levi’s portrayal of the character. With DC taking a different route and rebooting the entire franchise, it won’t come as a shock if Angel takes up the role of Grayson, aka Nightwing, in the upcoming film. Fans already know that Jason Momoa might not play Aquaman in the upcoming slate of films and will be introduced as Lobo in the DC Universe. So, if Momoa can do it, Angel could very well become the Nightwing.

Although no release date has been finalized for the project, Gunn has already made it clear that the film won’t be released after the completion of Matt Reeves’ Batman trilogy. On Threads, one of the fans asked if The Brave and the Bold would only be released after Reeves’ trilogy , to which the filmmaker simply said “No” in response. Even though The Brave and the Bold won't be affected by The Batman trilogy's schedule, Gunn's response doesn't offer any clarity on when fans can anticipate the DCU project's release. This uncertainty will likely keep speculation buzzing among fans. Nevertheless, it would be interesting to see how Gunn moves forward with the movie and which actor would portray The Dark Knight.

Batman: The Brave and the Bold is currently in early development.

MORE
6 DCEU Actors Who Should Stick Around In The Reboot

Some actors within the DCEU should stay as their respective characters, or be given new ones for when the rebooted DCU hits.

Source: AsherAngel/X

item.title: Stardew Valley Player Spots Surprising NPC Change In Update 1.6
item.description:
Highlights

  • Stardew Valley Update 1.6 brings the Dwarf out of the Mines for the first time, surprising players with new NPC sightings.
  • Developer ConcernedApe introduced significant changes in Update 1.6, including new outfits, dialogue, and reactions for Pelican Town citizens.
  • Players are loving the fresh content and fixes in Update 1.6, leading to record player counts and top sales for the beloved life-sim game.

Players continue to spot new changes in Stardew Valley after Update 1.6, including one fan who noticed that the Dwarf popped up at the Stardew Valley Fair, marking the first time the mysterious character has ever ventured out of the Mines. Stardew Valley Update 1.6 included a massive list of gameplay adjustments, content additions, and bug fixes, and the community has been working hard to discover each and every change and share the knowledge with fellow players.

First released in 2016, Stardew Valley is a life-sim game featuring farming, fishing, mining, foraging, and crafting mechanics. The game sees players take on the role of a farmer in the countryside of Pelican Town, which is home to a colorful cast of characters. While a majority of the NPCs have fixed schedules and distinct pathing, one lesser-known character has received a surprising change in Update 1.6.

Related
Stardew Valley Players Have Good Use for New Feature Added in Update 1.6

Players share a useful tip for fellow Stardew Valley fans, which takes advantage of a key change brought in Update 1.6.

During a fresh playthrough of Stardew Valley after Update 1.6, player Lupyx_of_Wallachia noticed that the Dwarf visited the Stardew Valley Fair, which marks the first time the curious NPC was spotted outside the Mines. The Dwarf in Stardew Valley is a mysterious creature, who cannot be spoken with until players uncover all the Dwarven Scrolls hidden throughout the Mines in the Mountain north of Robin's cabin. Once the player unlocks dialogue with the Dwarf, they will be able to purchase certain goods from the creature, such as bombs. Unlike the human NPCs of Pelican Town, the Dwarf never leaves his home in the Mines, save for a single cutscene in the sewers with Krobus. Following Update 1.6, however, the Dwarf can be seen in the town center for the first time in the game's history during the autumnal Stardew Valley Fair.

NPC Changes In Stardew Valley Update 1.6

Developer Eric "ConcernedApe" Barone made a slew of significant changes in Update 1.6, including a number of key adjustments and additions to NPCs. The citizens of Pelican Town received new seasonal outfits, over 100 lines of fresh dialogue, and dynamic reactions to player interactions, all of which have pleasantly surprised both new and returning players. ConcernedApe has also released a number of patches to Stardew Valley Update 1.6 , which have further improved gameplay mechanics, translations and localizations, and NPC behavior.

Fans have been loving all the new content and useful fixes in Update 1.6, with Stardew Valley reaching new player count records and leaping back to the top of the sales charts. From expansive lore and satisfying gameplay to adorable graphics and lovable NPCs, Stardew Valley has plenty to offer fans of life-sim gaming.

item.title: Rockstar Hints at Red Dead Redemption PC Port
item.description:
Highlights

  • A clear reference to a PC port of Red Dead Redemption 1 was found on one of Rockstar's websites.
  • The leaked product description states that the yet-to-be-announced PC version of the game will include the Undead Nightmare expansion.
  • May 18 will mark the 14th anniversary of Red Dead Redemption, which may be when Rockstar is planning to make its PC port official.

Rockstar has inadvertently hinted at a PC port of Red Dead Redemption being on the horizon. Specifically, a clear reference to the PC version of the first Red Dead Redemption game has been dug up from one of the company's websites.

May 18 will mark the 14th anniversary of the critically acclaimed Western action adventure. Back in August 2023, Rockstar finally treated the game to a re-release for modern platforms. But that Red Dead Redemption comeback was limited to the Switch and PS4 , much to the annoyance of the PC gaming crowd.

Related
Red Dead Redemption's New Ports are the Final Nail in the Coffin for Remake Rumors

News recently broke about PS4 and Switch ports for Red Dead Redemption, killing recent hype around a rumored remake or remaster for the title.

Reference to Red Dead Redemption 1 PC Port Found on Rockstar Website

Nine months later, it would appear that the PC port of the game may at last be on the horizon. That's suggested by a product blurb dug up from the Rockstar Launcher website by Twitter user and long-time leaker Tez2. The description is part of a JSON file that's still not visible on the website's frontend, but clearly references the first Red Dead Redemption , with the name of its key being "RDR_ProductPromotion_Intro_Body." Paired with this reference is a succinct description of the hit 2010 game, which ends by stating it is "now playable on PC."

Aside from pointing at another re-release of Red Dead Redemption , the newly leaked blurb also suggests that the PC version of the game may be content-complete, as it explicitly states that the Undead Nightmare standalone expansion is part of the yet-to-be-announced package. If the game's 2023 Switch and PS4 versions are any indication, the purported PC port will presumably also include the Red Dead Redemption Deadly Assassin Outfit add-on and other minor DLC packs that Rockstar put out over the years.

When Might Rockstar Announce the Red Dead Redemption 1 PC Port?

Given the timing and contents of this leak, the Red Dead Redemption PC port announcement may be imminent. If Rockstar were to use this purported re-release in a commemorative manner, then the official confirmation of its existence may arrive on or around this Saturday, May 18, which will mark the game's 14th anniversary.

The current prospects of the game's long-overdue PC port remain unclear. While PC gamers have long been asking for a chance to play it, its recent console re-release has been met with a polarizing reception from the fandom, as underlined by the fact that Red Dead Redemption ended up being review-bombed . Many fans participating in this pushback said they did so out of frustration over the lack of the game's much-requested remake.

item.title: Fallout 2 Deathclaws Almost Had Their Own Power Armor
item.description:
Highlights

  • Deathclaws in Fallout 2 almost had their own Power Armor, making them even more intimidating foes.
  • Originally created by the military, Deathclaws are apex predators in the Fallout wasteland.
  • The scrapped idea of intelligent Deathclaws with Power Armor adds an intriguing twist to the franchise.

The Deathclaws in Fallout 2 were almost even more intimidating, as they were originally supposed to have their own Power Armor in the game. Deathclaws have become notorious monsters in the franchise, but Fallout 2 almost made them even more difficult to face.

Originally created by the United States military, Deathclaws are genetically engineered creatures that were intended to replace human soldiers on the battlefield during close combat missions. However, after the events of the Great War, Deathclaws fled into the wild, quickly becoming one of the apex predators of America's post-nuclear wasteland. There are many horrifying threats that players should try to avoid in the Fallout franchise, but a run-in with a Deathclaw is one of the most dangerous encounters one can be faced with. These beasts are scary enough, but they were almost far more threatening.

Related
Fallout 4 Player Notices Interesting Codsworth Detail

An eagle-eyed gamer notices an interesting detail about Codsworth in Fallout 4's introduction, that most players will miss during their playthroughs.

In a recent interview that TheGamer did with Fallout 2 developer John Deiley, it was revealed that Deathclaws were almost given their own Power Armor. Deiley's original idea for the Deathclaws in Fallout 2 was to make them far more intelligent. With this intelligence, the Deathclaws would have found ways to modify this Power Armor in order to fit their hulking bodies, making them an even greater force to be reckoned with. The history of Deathclaws is fascinating enough, but the addition of Power Armor is an intriguing idea.

Vault 13 in Fallout 2 houses a group of intelligent Deathclaws that would have brought this Power Armor idea to life, but they are eventually killed off by a member of the Enclave.

Armored Deathclaws in Fallout 2

Ultimately, the idea of making Deathclaws intelligent was scrapped, which meant the armored version of Deathclaws never saw the light of day. Although this could have been a compelling direction to take, it would have made the behemoths that much more terrifying to deal with in the wild. The Fallout franchise has come a long way since Fallout 2 , but it's interesting to think about what could have been if this idea had been brought to life. Deiley states, "They were planning, once they were more secure, on altering power armor to fit their physique. And then they were going to pay the Enclave a visit and get as many vials of the FEV virus as they could, kidnap a scientist or two, and make some improvements."

They were planning, once they were more secure, on altering power armor to fit their physique.

Through the years, the various Fallout games have built upon a fascinating lore, but it's always interesting to think about the forgotten concepts that never got to be included in the final product. From intelligent Deathclaws to the mutated wolves that were cut from Fallout 3 , there is a long list of fascinating ideas that sadly didn't get added to the franchise's world.
